alert.note: Alert for Tuolumne; Yuba (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 2:00AM PST until March 10 at 10:30AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Placer. In northern California, Alpine, Amador, Butte, Calaveras, El Dorado, Lassen, Nevada, Plumas, Sierra, Tehama, Tuolumne and Yuba. * WHEN...Until 500 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 155 AM PST, California Highway Patrol reporting flooding of roadways in the Sierra Nevada, including on/off ramps along Interstate 80 near Cisco. Minor flooding is already occurring. - Moderate to heavy rain is forecast to continue in the advisory area through Friday. Low-lying areas with poor drainage from frozen/snowpack-covered drains will be susceptible to roadway flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Downieville, Blue Canyon, Sierra City, Baxter, Cisco, Quincy, Big Bend Summit, Chester, Mineral, Bear Valley, East Quincy, Alleghany, White Cloud Campground, Bowman Lake, Pike, Scotts Flat, Emigrant Gap, Lake Spaulding, Camptonville and La Porte. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
